oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Petition by the citizens of Dickson County to John Sevier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Petition by the citizens of Dickson County expressing their distress in relation to the Embargo Act. The petition includes many citizen signatures.

The Embargo Act of 1807 enacted by President Thomas Jefferson and made all exports from the United States illegal. The act was intended to punish Britian and France, but ulitmately harmed the United States economy. American merchants and farmers who shipped goods to Europe for profit were not in favor of the act.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Governor John Sevier Papers (Second Series of Administrations) 1803-1809
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sevier, John, 1745-1815; Embargo
